author: {'@type': 'Person', 'url': 'https://www.moneycontrol.com/author/pti-6883/', 'name': 'PTI'}
headline: NCLT clears way for liquidation of Moser Baer India
description: In a regulatory filing, Moser Baer said the decision has come on a plea filed by its lender Alchemist Asset Reconstruction Company Ltd.
articleBody: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has allowed insolvency proceedings against debt-ridden Moser Baer India, a manufacturer of CDs and DVDs.  In a regulatory filing, Moser Baer said the decision has come on a plea filed by its lender Alchemist Asset Reconstruction Company Ltd. The NCLT in its September 20 order has allowed liquidation of the company due to non-receipt of any resolution plan.  It has also appointed an Interim Resolution Professional (IRP), it said. The average liquidation value comes to Rs 337.45 crore.  The total financial debts due to financial creditors as on the corporate insolvency commencement date has been stated as Rs 4,356.12 crore, it added.

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'BSE Notices'}
headline: Moser Baer's appoints Surender Kumar Mata  as Company Secretary
description: We hereby inform that the Mr. Surender Kumar Mata is appointed as Company Secretary of the Company w.e.f. October 4, 2017 and Mr. Neeraj Parmar will continue to look after the Legal and Corporate functions of the Company.
articleBody: Pursuant to Securities And Exchange Board Of India (Listing Obligations And Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 ('Listing Regulations'), we hereby inform that the following changes in Key Managerial Personnel have taken place:  Mr. Surender Kumar Mata is appointed as Company Secretary of the Company w.e.f. October 4, 2017 and Mr. Neeraj Parmar will continue to look after the Legal and Corporate functions of the Company.Source : BSE

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'BSE Notices'}
headline: Moser Baer's CFO Yogesh Bahadur Mathur resigns
description: We hereby inform that the Mr. Yogesh Bahadur Mathur, Group President and Chief Financial Officer will step down as CFO and continue with the role of overseeing group affairs. The position for the new Chief Financial Officer position will be taken up and decided in the forthcoming Board Meeting.
articleBody: Pursuant to Securities And Exchange Board Of India (Listing Obligations And Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 ('Listing Regulations'), we hereby inform that the following changes in Key Managerial Personnel have taken place:  W.e.f. October 4, 2017, Mr. Yogesh Bahadur Mathur, Group President and Chief Financial Officer will step down as CFO and continue with the role of overseeing group affairs. The position for the new Chief Financial Officer position will be taken up and decided in the forthcoming Board Meeting.  Source : BSE

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'BSE Notices'}
headline: Moser Baer: Outcome of board meeting
description: The Board of Directors of the Company in its meeting, which concluded at 11.50 p.m. today, inter-alia considered, approved and taken on record the audited financial results of the Company for the quarter and financial year ended on 31st March, 2017.
articleBody: The Board of Directors of the Company in its meeting, which concluded at 11.50 p.m. today, inter-alia considered, approved and taken on record the audited financial results of the Company for the quarter and financial year ended on 31st March, 2017.     In this connection, please find attached herewith:-  1.A Copy of the audited financial results of the Company for the quarter and financial year ended on 31st March, 2017 alongwith audit report and Statement on Impact of Audit Qualifications pursuant to regulation 33(3)(d) of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulation, 2015.    2.Statement of assets and liabilities pursuant to regulation 33(3)(f) of SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulation, 2015.     3.A Copy of the Press Release.Source : BSE

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Faizan Javed'}
headline: Moser Baer India Q2 net loss at Rs 285 cr
description: The company had reported standalone net loss of Rs 138.17 crore in the year-ago period, it said in a filing to BSE. Total income from operations dropped to Rs 139.66 crore, over Rs 243.89 crore in the year-ago period.
articleBody: Moser Baer India Limited (MBIL) reported standalone net loss of Rs 284.98 crore in the quarter ended September 30, 2015. The company had reported standalone net loss of Rs 138.17 crore in the year-ago period, it said in a filing to BSE. Total income from operations dropped to Rs 139.66 crore, over Rs 243.89 crore in the year-ago period.  Moser Baer CEO Shiv Nath said, &quot;The company has focused on correcting the demand supply imbalance to regain its market share, especially in the international market. Recovery of OEM business expected from January 2016 onwards.&quot; &quot;Softening of key input costs in optical media accompanied by sustained cost reduction initiatives continued to support the business and offset softening of prices,&quot; Nath said. &quot;In the SSM segment, we are partnering with new OEMs to expand business.  We have expanded our presence in the LED segment and have been able to cover significant markets in East and North India,&quot; Nath added.
tags: BSE, consolidated net profit, Moser Baer (India), net profit, Results, Shiv Nath, total Income

headline: Moser Baer's operations of photo voltaic restore
description: Moser Baer India Ltd has informed BSE that the management of the Company and its subsidiaries, with the support of concerned government and administrative authorities, have reached an amicable settlement with the workers to end the unjustified stoppage of work. All operations including those of Photo Voltaic have been restored to normalcy.
articleBody: Moser Baer India Ltd has informed BSE that the management of the Company and its subsidiaries, with the support of concerned government and administrative authorities, have reached an amicable settlement with the workers to end the unjustified stoppage of work. All operations including those of Photo Voltaic have been restored to normalcy.Source : BSE Read all announcements in Moser Baer

author: {'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'webtech_news18'}
headline: Moser Baer India allots 1.34cr equity shares to Microgreon Electronics
description: Moser Baer India in their meeting held on March 31, 2015 issued and allotted 1,34,50,000 equity shares of Rs. 10/- each for cash at par on preferential basis to M/s. Microgreon Electronics Private Limited, a Promoter Group Company.
articleBody: Moser Baer India Ltd has informed BSE that subject to necessary approvals, the allotment committee of the Board of Directors has in their meeting held on March 31, 2015 issued and allotted 1,34,50,000 equity shares of Rs. 10/- each for cash at par on preferential basis to M/s. Microgreon Electronics Private Limited, a Promoter Group Company. The allotment is in terms of approval of shareholders accorded vide Special Resolution passed on March 30, 2015, by way of postal ballot and under Corporate Debt Restructuring Scheme.Source : BSE Read all announcements in Moser Baer

articleBody: Moser Baer India Ltd has informed BSE regarding a Press Release dated November 18, 2014, titled &quot;Moser Baer India pledges to save 50 MW of energy through its energy efficient LED lighting technologies in two years&quot;Source : BSE Read all announcements in Moser Baer
